parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Perception, understanding, discernment. From aisthanomai; perception, i.e. discernment.
